meanings.definition: relating to the study of embryos
meanings.sent1: The embryological research focused on the early stages of development.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use embryological techniques to understand how embryos grow.
meanings.sent3: The professor's passion for embryological studies was evident in every lecture.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of embryological details was as intricate as a spider's web.
meanings.sent5: The textbook provided a vivid description of the embryological processes.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the development of an embryo
meanings.sent1: The embryological changes in the egg were carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study embryological development to ensure healthy pregnancies.
meanings.sent3: The chef's creative dish had an embryological twist with its layered ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The city's growth mirrored the embryological progress of a tiny seed.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting captured the beauty of embryological transformation.

meanings.sent1: The embryological lab was equipped with advanced microscopes.
meanings.sent2: Researchers collaborate on embryological projects to advance medical knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about embryological experiments left the audience chuckling.
meanings.sent4: The team's unity was as strong as the bond between embryological researchers.
meanings.sent5: The documentary provided a fascinating insight into the world of embryological studies.
